New Records: Jared Jones allowed a season-high six earned runs in the game, raising his ERA to 6.15 in his five starts since returning from the injured list; Jones pitched 128 1/3 innings in the season, a new career high
Key Match Events: Jones allowed two home runs, including a three-run shot by Elly De La Cruz, and a two-run shot by Ty France; Jones' velocity was down, averaging 95.9 mph on his four-seam fastball compared to 97.3 mph earlier in the season
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Derek Shelton noted Jones' inconsistency in the second half of the season, attributing it to his first Major League season and a recent injury recovery; Jones was expected to provide consistent performance but faced challenges in maintaining his early-season form
Post-Match Reflections: Jones expressed frustration with his performance, stating 'everything was terrible today'; Manager Shelton emphasized the need for Jones to improve consistency for future success; Jones' status as a key rookie pitcher for the Pirates was highlighted
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in muggy conditions; Jones was confirmed to be OK despite a panic moment in the fifth inning; Jones' performance was a significant factor in the Pirates' 7-1 loss
